required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Association Between Knee Isokinetic Testing and Lower Limb Functional Performance and Limb Symmetry
clinical_study.official_title: Association Between Knee Isokinetic Testing and Lower Limb Functional Performance and Limb Symmetry

brief_summary.textblock:
This study aimed to evaluate the association between the isokinetic knee strength and/or proprioception performance with the functional performance on the functional Hop-tests and Y-balance test.
This study included 20 healthy individuals who performed an isokinetic assessment of knee proprioception (joint position sense, JPS and threshold to detection of passive motion, TDPM) and flexors/extensors strength. At the same time, they performed a functional testing consisting of three Hop-tests (single, triple and cross-over) and the Lower Quarter Y-Balance Test (YBT-LQ). We tested the correlation between the isokinetic and functional performances, and limb symmetry indexes.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one evaluation at a single point in time through study completion, an average of 4 months
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of knee extensors and flexors peak strength (in newton.meter, Nm) on isokinetic dynamometer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one evaluation at a single point in time through study completion, an average of 4 months
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of knee proprioception by the passive repositioning technique (JPS, in degrees) on isokinetic dynamometer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one evaluation at a single point in time through study completion, an average of 4 months
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of knee proprioception by the active repositioning technique (JPS, in degrees) on isokinetic dynamometer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one evaluation at a single point in time through study completion, an average of 4 months
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of knee proprioception by the Threshold to Detection of Passive Motion (TDPM in degrees) on isokinetic dynamometer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one evaluation at a single point in time through study completion, an average of 4 months
primary_outcome.description: Hop test. Single hop: Patients are instructed to stand on one leg and perform 1 jump as far as possible, landing on the same leg. The total distance is recorded (in cm) .Triple hop: Patients are instructed to stand on one leg and perform 3 hops as far as possible, landing on the same leg. The total distance for 3 consecutive hops is recorded (in cm). Cross-over hop test : The patient hops forward 3 times while alternately crossing over a marking The patient is instructed to position themselves such that the first of the 3 hops was lateral with respect to the direction of crossover The total distance hopped forward is recorded (in cm)

intervention.description: All the participants performed the isokinetic proprioception and strength tests and the functional tests, on the same visit.

study_pop.textblock: Young healthy adults who volunteered to participate in this study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- individuals under 45 years of age who performed at least 4 hours of physical activity per week.
Exclusion Criteria:
- individuals unable to perform isokinetic muscle tests
- individuals with a current or recent lower limb injury with time loss from sport participation within the previous month
- individuals with previous severe knee injury (eg. Severe ligament tear, knee fracture)
- individuals taking medications with potential balance/coordination side effects.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Physician in the Sport Medicine Department (MD), PhD student
